title: 114_hr3794
content: The "Nonprofit Property Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. It pertains to commercial insurance. The Liability Risk Retention Act of 1986 is amended to include a new definition of 'commercial insurance' that excludes health, life, disability insurance, workers compensation insurance, and express contractual obligations related to personal transactions. The Liability Risk Retention Act of 1986 is amended to include a new provision allowing risk retention groups to provide commercial insurance to nonprofit organizations and educational institutions under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Risk Retention Group must be a nonprofit or governmental entity, chartered as an insurance company for at least ten years, maintain a capital of $10,000,000, and cover risks with a total insured value. The total insured value of risks covered by the initial policy for other forms of commercial insurance provided by a risk retention group to any one member should not exceed $50,000,000. This amount will be adjusted annually based on the Consumer Price Index. The total insured value for liability insurance coverage provided by a risk retention group to any member should be excluded from the computation. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AND CLARIFYING AMENDMENTS. The Liability Risk Retention Act of 1986 is amended to include provisions related to liability and other commercial risks in various sections. The Liability Risk Retention Act of 1986 is amended to include provisions related to liability and other commercial risks, such as inserting "or other forms of commercial" before "insurance by a risk retention group" in section 6(b) (15 U.S.C. 3905(b)). SEC. 4. AMENDMENT TO SHORT TITLE: The Liability Risk Retention Act of 1986 is amended by changing the title to the Risk Retention Act of 1986.
